benchmark_details.name: REAL (Benchmarking Autonomous Agents on Deterministic Simulations of Real Websites)
benchmark_details.overview: REAL is a benchmark and framework for multi-turn agent evaluations on deterministic simulations of real-world websites. It comprises high-fidelity, publicly hosted, deterministic replicas of 11 widely-used websites across various domains, designed for evaluating the capabilities and reliability of autonomous agents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to evaluate and improve the accuracy and reliability of autonomous web agents in performing complex tasks.

data.source: 11 high-fidelity, deterministic replicas of popular websites developed using React and Next.js.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on task completion and correctness determined through programmatic state verification or rubric-based evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy rate indicates better performance in completing the tasks as specified.
methodology.baseline_results: The current best model achieves a success rate of 41.07% in task performance.
